snippet: Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez, who killed four Marines, was known as handsome and polite, and had a blog where he posted about Islam. He was not under investigation by the F.B.I.
abstract: Neighbors of Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez, suspect in killing of four Marines and wounding of at least three other people in Chattanooga, Tenn, in act described as domestic terrorism, say he never showed signs of Islamic extremism.

byline.contributor: Reporting for this article was contributed by Matt Apuzzo, Eric Schmitt, Matthew Rosenberg and Gardiner Harris from Washington; Jess Bidgood from Boston; and Richard Pérez-Peña and Dave Philipps from New York. Jack Begg and Elisa Cho contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez, who killed four Marines, was known as handsome and polite, and had a blog where he posted about Islam. He was not under investigation by the F.B.I.

headline.main: Chattanooga Gunman Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez: ‘Life Is Short and Bitter’
headline.print_headline: Passage From Whiffle Ball to ‘Life Is Short and Bitter’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
